alert.note: Alert for Capitan And Sacramento Mountains; South Central Lowlands And Southern Rio Grande Valley; Southwest Deserts and Lowlands; Southwest Mountains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS El Paso (Southern New Mexico and extreme Western Texas)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued May 29 at 10:31PM MDT until May 30 at 8:00PM MDT by NWS El Paso
info.description: ...ELEVATED TO CRITICAL FIRE WEATHER CONDITIONS ARE EXPECTED ON MONDAY... .An approaching upper level system will create strong southwest winds Monday afternoon. Winds strengthen in the afternoon hours and afternoon humidity values remain extremely dry. A very dry spring has led to extremely dry fuels over much of southern New Mexico and far west Texas. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON TO 8 PM MDT MONDAY FOR LOW HUMIDITY AND STRONG WINDS FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 110, 111, 112, AND 113... * WIND...Southwest winds of 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 40 mph. * HUMIDITY...5 to 14%. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended. Please check with the local agencies for updated burn ban information.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.

area.areaDesc: Capitan And Sacramento Mountains; South Central Lowlands And Southern Rio Grande Valley; Southwest Deserts and Lowlands; Southwest Mountains
